items.text:
Table 1 shows
which versions of Android support allowlisting apps by user.
A DPC must allowlist apps before they can be used in lock task mode.

Call
ActivityOptions.setLockTaskEnabled() and supply these
options when starting the activity.

The following snippet shows one way you can
do this:

In Android versions before 9.0, an app starts its own activities in lock task
mode by calling Activity.startLockTask().

You can call KeyguardManager methods to
find out if the device is locked and use an Activity lifecycle
callback (such as onResume() that's called after unlocking) to
start lock task mode.

In Android 9.0 or higher when lock task mode is enabled, your DPC can enable
certain system UI features on the device—useful to developers creating a custom
launcher.
The system disables any features you don’t include in the flags argument.
Table 2 describes the UI features you can customize.
